job_title: Teacher/Instructor in Rio Rancho, NM
pros: Great work schedule Good co workers Good pay
cons: Pto need more time for employees.

job_title: Applications Release Manager in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Mission Driven Nonprofit with focus on patient care.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Farmington, NM
pros: Very professional work place, includes benefits, friendly staff willing to help.
cons: Got put in a different job position on my first day not expecting it at all, not good with direct communication (found out important information about myself and position through other co-workers rather than my supervisor).

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Santa Fe, NM
pros: I feel feel like overall, my manger is pretty supportive. There is supervision which I like, and they are trying their best to put together employee get-together's for the holidays. I appreciate that they provide food. My clinic also has coffee, and that's really great they provide that. They are also open to hearing new ideas for growth.
cons: It feels like there is a pressure for numbers more than employee satisfaction or therapist well-being (e.g in supervision, my supervisor says 'lets look at your caseload' vs 'how are you managing everything'). Supervision often becomes very administrative before therapist's needs and I hear that from other who have different managers than my own. I have to send my daily caseload at the end of every day and I feel shameful if I don't have people show, or if I note I did not get my billing completed that day - some things that are in place like that are not explained why we have to do them so it feels like micromanagement seeing that I know other clinics in PMS do not have to do this. There is also frequent turn over so cases get given out frequently and it makes me fearful as a new employee.

job_title: Clinical Services Supervisor in Farmington, NM
pros: Coworkers, lots of openings, decent benefits.
cons: I started out as a therapist and regretted moving up into management. Inconsistent systems, policies and procedures. Electronic Health Record is clunky and the training provided wasn't adequate. As a supervisor I couldn't make needed edits in the Electronic Health Record.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Albuquerque, NM
pros: PMS provides support where needed and never makes you feel like you should already know how to deal.
cons: None everything works well at PmS

job_title: Care Coordinator in Irvine, CA
pros: Management listens to you Remote Benefits

job_title: Registered Dental Hygienist in Irvine, CA
pros: The providers at Presbyterian Medical Services really care for the patients well-being. It's a positive work environment with good pay and great benefits.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Irvine, CA

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Albuquerque, NM
pros:
-Good policies and policy revision
-Adequate practice space and office setting is nice
-Excellent schedule - M-F, 8-5, no weekends, no call 
-NHSC eligible for student loan repayment (years of commitment required though)
-Excellent PTO package and relatively easily to get the time off
-Patient centered medical home to help care for most of a patient's needs - medical, dental, therapy, CCSS, PSR, psychiatry
cons:
-Administration can be non-responsive at times when basic things are needed to maintain your practice - like a working computer or other very basic necessary logistics.
-Negative projections onto staff from management at times - this seems to be improving over the years though - probably because this organization started doing employee satisfaction surveys for the very first time starting two years ago. Obviously this company is way behind the 8 ball on this compared to other large healthcare organizations. 
-Heavy productivity requirements
-No caseload analysis or productivity feedback with template revisions- they just keep on scheduling more and more people without administration circling back to see how you're doing.

job_title: Applications Analyst in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Company that truly gives back to the community. Places to move up in the company.
cons: Low pay and sometimes lack of communication in certain departments

job_title: Supervisor in Santa Fe, NM
pros: Work/life balance is wonderful, opportunities to really serve the community in a variety of ways, the mission of PMS is carried out every day and supported, no one is turned away regardless of ability to pay, truly there for those who need the support
cons: Honestly the pros far outweigh anything else. If you come to work with the right mindset of serving the community, there are no cons because this company allows you to do just that, serve those in need

review_title: Great place to start.  Every business location has unique pros/cons

review_title: Upper Management needs major improvement & a reality check
job_title: Administrative Position in Santa Fe, NM
pros: They have good people working for them, but management is clueless about how to keep them happy, so they have high employee turnover.  They lose good people who would be assets to their company and they could care less about it.
cons: Lots.  Employee morale is very low.  I blame that on terrible management.  They only care for themselves and the very few "incentives" they think makes employees happy...people could care less about.  Management ignores major issues because if it's making them money, that's all they care about.

review_title: Presbyterian Medical Service is an amazing company to work for if you want to make a difference in someone's life.
job_title: Medical Records Technician in Cuba, NM
pros: Presbyterian Medical Services (PMS) gives everybody at this company an opportunity to put their best foot forward and help out the people that need it, especially in the rural communities.  PMS offers a variety of services that help people out with regardless of their ability to pay, their race, their gender etc., everybody is treated with respect.   It also offers good benefits, it helps pay for further education if an employee desires it, paid holiday's, great paid time off accumulation, weekends off and a chance to make great friends out of co-workers.
cons: The trainings are not very clear at times.

job_title: Anonymous in Santa Fe, NM
pros: I have worked at PMS for over 15 years.  I love my job and this mission-driven organization.  It is a well managed and highly ethical company.  My colleagues are smart and enthusiastic about their jobs.  I plan to stay here until I retire.  It has been a great place to grow my career.  PMS has given its employees an annual increase every year I have worked here.  The benefits package is extremely robust and competitive.
cons: No cons at this time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Paid time off, vacation, convenient location, positive mission
cons: Poor management, lack of vision for department and little insight regarding strategies to effectively complete tasks, for the most part time poorly utilized, cubicle

review_title: Best company for therapists to develop clinical skills
job_title: Clinical Services Supervisor in Espanola, NM
pros: Best company to develop & refine clinical skills. Student loan repayment plan. Strong leadership team. Working with under served communities in NM. Rewarding work, making a difference.
cons: Unhappy employees who create & perpetuate a toxic work place & not being able to be in their integrity to just leave. Clinical providers who do not invest in their own mental health. Unprofessional behavior that harms clients & the company. Lengthy corrective & termination process.

job_title: Business Office Supervisor in Farmington, NM
pros:
PMS deeply believes and upholds their mission (at the clinic level). It was refreshing to work for an organization that strives to help people as much as employees do here. Corporate does not necessarily echo those beliefs, most likely due to their removal from the  on-site operations. It is a very diverse work environment with something new to learn/do each day. 

You will grow in your skillset immensely during your time here and you will learn to interact with every walk of person.
cons:
I was a manager at one of the clinics. The corporate HR burden of constantly having to review employees despite there being no tangible benefit to doing so (no raise, bonus, really anything). It seems like the only way HR could think to make employees feel more valued and maybe not turn over as frequently, but it really only stresses out managers who are already overburdened with everything else they have to do.

Dealing with coworkers was hit or miss. Sometimes everyone was in a good mood, but other time people were just mean to each other. I tried to maintain positivity to help morale in the clinic and it was suffocatingly difficult to do in the wake of such overwhelming negativity.

job_title: Children's Services in Farmington, NM
pros: The pay and benefits are good. You will be treated well and provided opportunities for personal growth. Time-off is flexible and easy to obtain.
cons: The communication from the corporate office is lacking. Employees often are not aware of changes that have been made that effect thier job. Important information is passed along from person to person so you are not sure if you are getting the correct info.

review_title: BEST PLACE, BEST PEOPLE IN THE WORLD!!!  PROGRESSIVE COMPANY!!
job_title: CPSW/CCSS/PACT in Santa Fe, NM
pros: CARING PEOPLE PROVIDING THE BEST SERVICE AVAILABLE IN NEW MEXICO - Santa Fe Community Guidance Center, a non-profit program of Presbyterian Medical Services (PMS), provides counseling, case management, and primary health care services for all ages. Sliding fee scale is available for those with no insurance. Conveniently located in southern Santa Fe at 2960 Rodeo Park Drive West, near Eye Associates.
cons: The pay is not the best, but the benefits & superb team of co-workers/colleagues and management make up for it.

job_title: General Accountant in Santa Fe, NM
